snippet: A number of factors have conspired to produce painful scenes in the death chamber, experts say, including an ill-conceived drug formulation clung to by many states.
abstract: Botched execution in Oklahoma of inmate Clayton D Lockett raises questions of why three-drug protocol persists for lethal injections, when technology clearly exists to bring quick and painless death; experts say ill-conceived drug formulation clung to by many states, lack of medical expertise among people planning and carrying out executions, and drug shortages are to blame.
lead_paragraph: A number of factors have conspired to produce painful scenes in the death chamber, experts say, including an ill-conceived drug formulation clung to by many states.

headline.main: Three-Drug Protocol Persists for Lethal Injections, Despite Ease of Using One
headline.print_headline: Three-Drug Protocol Persists for Lethal Injections, Despite Ease of Using One
